ftbquests.chapter.attack_of_the_drones.q: The &6Amadron Trade Network&r offers a random assortment of pre-existing villager trades that will refresh each Minecraft day. There are also some pack and mod specific trades that will always be available so make sure to keep checking back!

One trade of particular interest to the avid explorers may be the &dEnder Apple&r trade. By trading an Ender Apple, you can obtain an &6Enchanted Book of Stepping&r. When applied to any boots, it will grant you permanent step assist. Great for all those hills and mountains around!
On Walkabout
&6Advanced Pressure Tubes&r can handle up to 25 BAR and 4 times the volume.
Before you can connect these to your machines, make sure they can handle the increased volume and pressure, or you can use a &bRegulator&r instead!
Advanced Pressure Tubes
When pressurized, the &bAerial Interface&r exposes your inventory as if were in a chest. Any items inserted into the interface enter your inventory instead.
Your main inventory is accessed from any horizontal side while your armor is the top face. This can be changed in the UI.

Having this set up also provides &6water breathing&r, at an additional air pressure cost. If you provide it with FE, it will also wirelessly charge all your items! A dispenser upgrade will automatically eat for you, as well as allowing you to pipe experience in and out.
This can be used to keep your chestplate charged, and your chestplate can be upgraded to charge all other PNC armors and items.

&6Pneumatic Armor&r, though it has fairly low defense at the start, can be extensively upgraded. These upgrades can give it more armor, toughness, speed, flight, nightvision, and more! The Chestpiece can also be upgraded to charge all of your pneumatic devices.
This armor does not have infinite durability like some other tech armors, but can be upgraded to automatically repair with pressure.
I am (Compressed) Iron Man!
A &bThermopneumatic Processing Plant&r is used to process liquids into other liquids. It can also be used in fuel cracking!
&bHeavy Fuels&r can be cracked into lighter ones, which means &6Diesel&r can be turned into &6Kerosene&r, which can then turn into &bGasoline&r, and then further into &6LPG&r.
This machine can also be used to produce &aLubricant&r!
Once you have access to &bPolyethylene&r using a Chemical Reactor, you can process in this machine to make &6Plastic Sheets&r for making PCBs!
&6Speed Upgrades&r can be used in most PNC machines to make them work faster at the cost of using more pressure.
The &bCharging Station&r allows you to fill items with &6compressed air&r, allowing them to work.
It will only fill items to have equal pressure that the Charging Station itself has. If the item has higher pressure than the Charging Station, it will empty itself back into the network.
The &bCharging Module&r can be placed on a pressure tube and it will charge all items in the inventory it's facing.
It can also discharge them if their pressure exceeds the Tube's. If you put these on two connected Ender Chests you can effectively &bteleport air pressure&r!
The &6Minigun&r will shoot Minigun Ammo using compressed air by holding right-click.
Sneak click the Minigun to insert up to 4 &bMinigun Ammo&r boxes. Minigun Ammo can be combined with a potion to apply its effects on hit.
You can install several useful upgrades to the Minigun in the charging station to improve its functionality!
The Camouflage Applicator can make camouflageable blocks such as tubes and heat pipes look like other blocks!
Sneak + Right Click the applicator on a block (like grass or diamond) then click on any camouflageable block to set its appearance.

&bAir Pressure&r is what powers most Pneumaticcraft machines. It is measured in &6BAR&r. The higher the BAR, the higher the pressure! Air moves from high-pressure areas to low-pressure areas and will try to equalize throughout the system.
If the air pressure in a machine or tube is higher than it can support, the &cmachine will explode&r!
PneumaticCraft machines and tools all have a specific &6volume&r (measured in ML) that represents how much air they hold at 0 bar. This can be increased with Volume upgrades.
Machines use compressed air to operate, which constantly lowers pressure in the system as they consume it.
Make sure to &6read the PNC:R Manual&r for more information.
Air Pressure
Air Pressure 101
The &bPressure Chamber&r is a multiblock machine that takes pressure input and items to compress them into new items.
This multiblock must be built as a square with the dimensions 3x3, 4x4 or 5x5. Bigger Pressure Chambers allow for more advanced crafting recipes, but take longer to pressurize.
To build the &6Pressure Chamber&r, start by building the frame using &bPressure Chamber Walls&r. The faces of the walls can be built out of &bPressure Chamber Glass&r instead of walls if you'd like!

To interact with the Pressure Chamber, we'll need to use at least 2 &6Pressure Chamber Interfaces&r. Depending on how you place them will determine whether it can pull in items, or push them out. The square is the input side, and the circle is the output!
For the Chamber to compress items, we'll need to pump in compressed air into a &6Pressure Chamber Valve&r.
Precious Pressure
Now that we have a way to make Compressed Iron, we can get started with &bPneumaticCraft!&r
To start, we'll need to make some &bPressure Tubes&r, which are used to carry &6compressed air&r. If the pressure inside of a tube reaches 5.0 bar, it will explode. :)

Air pressure also takes time to build up and change; it isn't transferred instantly. Air pressure also relies on a &6closed system&r, meaning it will escape from open pipe connections and will lower the pressure of the entire system. Right clicking on a connection with a &6Pneumatic Wrench&r will close that section.
Pushing Pressure
&bHeat&r is another mechanic unique to Pneumaticcraft.&6 Heat disperses&r to adjacent blocks, including air.
If certain heat sources have their heat dispersed entirely, it can convert to a different block. An example of this would be using lava to heat a machine and it eventually cooling to obsidian.
You can prevent heat from dissipating in the air by making sure the block is covered by any block that isnt air. &6Thermal Lagging&r works well for this.

Some operations are endothermic (Heat Using) while others may be exothermic (Heat Producing). This will depend on the machine and recipe so be sure to look at the recipe and plan your heat management accordingly.

An important note is that since these machines share heat, it is often useful to put multiple machines that require similar temperatures touching each other to make heat management easier. You can pipe between them with &6Dispenser Upgrades&r.
Thermodynamics
The &bVortex Tube&r uses compressed air to make one side &bcold&r and the other side &chot&r.
The higher the airflow, the more extreme the temperature difference will be.
&bHeat Sinks&r can help to more quickly dissipate heat from a block they are touching.

Any heat sinks over or under 60/-60C will hurt you if you touch them. The effectiveness can be greatly increased by using an air grate to vent air over the fin. These used in conjunction with vortex tubes should be able to effectively handle all of your heating and cooling requirements.
The &bFluid Mixer&r mixes two fluids, as the name would imply. It can make either an item or another fluid.
One significant use for this is producing &6Biodiesel&r, which is the corner stone of your enhanced power production.
The &6Pneumatic Dynamo&r converts excess pressure into FE.
Let's make a Pneumatic Dynamo
Pressure → FE
Although a bit expensive, this &6Solar Compressor&r may be an interesting Air Compressor to have attached to your system as it is a passive source of Pressure!
At &e&n350°C&r, you'll get the &e&nmost efficiency&r&r out of this device. If it gets too hot, the machine will shut down!
Let's make a Solar Compressor
Using the Sun to Pressurize your System!
The &6Flux Compressor&r is an Air Compressor that converts &bFE&r or &bEU&r into Pressure!
Let's make a Flux Compressor!
By applying a Polyethylene layer to your &bBasic Pressure Tubes&r, you're able to upgrade them to &bReinforced Pressure Tubes&r, allowing them to handle up to 10 BAR of pressure!
&cMake sure to balance your pressure system accordingly&r.
Using Polyethylene!
Reinforced Pressure Tubes
- &5First&r make yourself a &bProgramming Table&r, you're going to use it to write what your &bDrone&r is going to do.
- &5Then&r make sure to have some &6Puzzle Pieces&r with you, &nevery step&r of the code requires &61 Puzzle Piece&r.
- Its also important to have &aGPS tools&r with you, as you'll use them to set cordinates for your &bDrone&r instructions.
Seems complicated, but its actually quite simple.
Harvesting Crops with Drones Part I
The &6Crop Support&r will work to increase the growth speed of any trees or crops that are planted on it. These are pretty cheap and require no upkeep to use, making them really useful for farming!
Faster Farming!

- Although there's a &6pre-programmed harvesting drone&r, in this quest we are going to teach you how to make one yourself, this should give you a good headstart on how this &bprogramming system&r works.
- &5First&r, make sure to open your &2Programming Table&r and import this basic code:
&8&oIt shouldn't be too hard, look for the "Import Button" at the top left of the GUI and after that click on the "paste from clipboard" option in the bottom.&r
- &5With this&r you can notice that &b"Drone Code"&r is done via &b"Code Blocks/Steps"&r you can start by placing the &b"Start Block"&r and then add a block for each respective step of the process.

- &5Also notice&r that when adding commands to &aharvest and/or import&r something from a chest, an &b&n"Area Block"&r&r is needed, and to easily add the corret cordinates, simply &bleft click with your GPS Tool&r to paste the desired cordinates.

&5Oh and don't forget&r that you can also add &a"Filter Blocks"&r to certain commands, in this given code, you may want to set a &aFilter for the Hoe&r you wish to use instead of a default netherite one.
&5And as a bonus tip&r, its a good practice to add a &9"Standby"&r command at the end so your drone can shut itself off when no work is needed, thus &9not wasting its pressure&r.
&oRead the Next Quest for a Simple Tutorial on how to set a Collector Drone too!&r
{image:ftbneotech:textures/quest/quest_drone_1.png width:120 height:100 align:center fit:true}
{image:ftbneotech:textures/quest/quest_drone_1.png width:120 height:100 align:center fit:true}
Click Here for the Code
Making a Basic Harvester Drone
Harvesting Crops with Drones Part II

Although there's a &6pre-programmed collector drone&r, in this quest we are going to teach you how to make one yourself, this should give you a good headstart on how this &bprogramming system&r works.
&5First&r, make sure to open your &2Programming Table&r and import this basic code:
&8&oIt shouldn't be too hard, look for the "Import Button" at the top left of the GUI and after that click on the "paste from clipboard" option in the bottom. &r
&5If you didn't read&r the previous quest, &c&nmake sure to do so&r&r, as the explanation here will be much simpler than the previous one!
&5Like mentioned previously&r, with this given code you should only need to tweak &athe values&r to your specific needs, like changing the &blocations&r:)

&5Also good to note&r that some &b"Code Blocks"&r like the &2"Export to Chest"&r one may have some additional config options that can be accessed via &nright click&r, in this case, you can select from which side the &bdrone&r will access the &2chest&r.
{image:ftbneotech:textures/quest/quest_drone_2.png width:120 height:100 align:center fit:true}
Click Here for the Code
Making a Basic Collector Drone
Harvesting Crops with Drones Final Part
&bReinforced Stone&r is the basis for most advanced pneumatic machinery. It's hardened and thermally resistant nature makes it a perfect material to contain the high pressure of pneumatic devices.
You'll need a good bit of these to craft a lot of the machines in the mod!

The basic &bAir Compressor&r is one of the first and easiest methods of &6generating pressure&r. This device will consume burnable materials like coal or charcoal to generate air pressure for the pneumatic network. Be careful not to over pressurize&r your systems or they will blow up!
We've gifted you a &6Saftey Tube Module&r to help get you started. These might work for now, but are not a good long term solution as they will occasionally vent pressure, which wastes fuel.
&bGenerating&r &dAir Pressure&r

Using the rewards from the previous quest, you should be able to make yourself an &dAmadron Tablet&r. This will allow you to trade on the Amadron network for all sorts of custom and vanilla villager trades!
Make sure you link it to an inventory by sneak+right clicking it and enjoy all of the new trades! You'll also want to make sure to keep it charged.
The Amadron Network
By having access to the &6Amadron Tablet&r, you can buy a &bPCB Blueprint&r and make yourself your first &bUV Light Box&r!
This Light Box is needed to expose &bEmpty PCB's&r to UV Light, which is an important process for assembling PCBs. You can make Empty PCBs in the Pressure Chamber!
A UV Light Box
Making Circuit Boards!
After we've exposed &bEmpty PCBs&r to UV Light, we can take the next step in the process by making an &6Etching Tank&r.
Fill this with &bEtching Acid&r and insert &bEmpty PCB&r's which have been exposed in a &6UV Light Box&r. To get Etching Acid, you'll need to have made &dVirulent Mix&r first!
If you want the tank to work faster, you can heat it above 50°C, but the Etching Acid will slowly be used due to the heat.
If the etching was successful, you'll get &6Unassembled PCB's&r as a result. If the process fails, you'll get &bFailed PCB's&r instead.
If you want to automate this, you can extract Unassembled PCB's from the sides, and Failed PCB's
from the top/bottom.

Slapping some &3{item.pneumaticcraft.transistor}s&r and &3{item.pneumaticcraft.capacitor}s&r on the &6{item.pneumaticcraft.unassembled_pcb}&r will finally yield a &b{item.pneumaticcraft.printed_circuit_board}&r.

If you haven't been using &6Gauge Modules&r to control your &3pressure system&r, perhaps it is a good idea to start doing so. Using an &bExpansion Module&r could make this process much easier and precise!
By applying an &bExpansion Module&r to a &6Gauge Controller&r, you'll expand its functionalities, allowing you to precisely control its &credstone behavior&r. You can even set a &eLinear Graph&r!
Let's make Expansion Modules!
Expanding Capabilities!
The &6Assembly Line&r is a multiblock machine allowing you to craft specific items with precision. All parts of the assembly line must touch and pressure needs to be provided to the controller.
Additionally, a &bprogram&r must be inserted into the &6Assembly Controller&r. Most recipes will use the &bLaser Program&r to start with.
&bAssembly IO Units&r control the input and output of the recipes. They must be able to reach an inventory, such as a chest, and the assembly platform. They can reach anything with a 3x3 area.
Assembly Line
ftbquests.chapter.caveman_goes_tech.ques: Mine up some &6raw iron ore&r and use it to crudely craft an &bEngineer's Hammer&r. While it's not the &obest&r to use, this is how we'll smash down our ores down for now.
Using this hammer, you can smash &6raw iron ore&r in your crafting grid into &6tiny dust&r. Smelt this iron dust in a furnace to obtain your first few iron ingots!
The hammer is also important for forming &eImmersive Engineering&r multiblocks!
&6Engineer's Hammer&r
&6Steel&r is obtained by blasting &bUncooked Steel Dust&r in a &6Blast Furnace&r. The &6Steam Blast Furnace&r will do this faster than its Immersive Engineering counterpart.

The Immersive Engineering &6Blast Furnace&r doesn't require &7Steam&r to operate and can later be upgraded with &6Blast Furnace Preheaters&r. Either way you'll need the basic &7Steam&r &6Blast Furnace&r to make the &6Immersive Blast Bricks&r

The &eImmersive Engineering&r &6Blast Furnace&r can also create &6steel&r without the need for &7steam&r. It does so at a much slower rate however, and the &6Steam Blast Furnace&r is required to make the more compacted blast bricks necessary to craft it. This is an &loptional&r multiblock you can use or not at your discretion.
Immersive Blast Furnace
The &bSteam Blast Furnace&r is your first major &eModern Industrialization&r multiblock. You'll need to give it &6steam&r &2inputs&r and &6uncooked steel dust&r for it to make &6steel ingots&r.

In addition to the controller block, you'll need a fluid and item &2input hatch&r as well as an item &coutput hatch&r as shown in the quest. The remaining blocks should be fire clay bricks. You can configure the inputs and outputs in many different ways. Holding the wrench or an &2input&r/&coutput&r hatch should show you where the valid placements are.
&bSteel&r is a hearty enough metal to open up many Industrial Machines and can be directly used to create &6upgrades&r for your &6bronze machines&r to upgrade them to their steel variants.
&l&6HINT&r: You will need A LOT of this. Keep it cooking as often as possible.
The &bWiremill&r is needed to make MOST forms of wire and fine wire. You'll be using this machine quite a bit to make circuits and more intricate machinery, items, and gear.
It's &6generally worth upgrading&r to the highest tier that your current technological progression will allow for.
&bMixers&r are used to combine multiple components and sometimes liquids into new ingredients. Make sure to pay attention to the tier of mixer required for recipes!
2 eu/t is a &bsteam mixer&r. 4 eu/t is a steel mixer, any higher than that will require an electric mixer or better.

The &bCompressor&r will take many gem-like materials, among other things, and &6compress&r them into a useable &6plate&r form. A perfect example of this can be seen in the reward from this quest! Why 2 Diamond Plates specifically?
Head over to the
Dimension Hopping
chapter to see what they are for!
&bSteel Boilers&r produce twice as much &7Steam&r as Bronze Boilers.

&bSteel upgrades&r can be shape crafted OR applied directly to bronze tier machines in world by &6right clicking&r the upgrade onto them. This will perform an in-place upgrade to the new steel variant and immediately be ready for processing!
&bCompressed Iron&r is a much stronger version of the smelted iron we normally make, but it can only be created under high pressures.

Unfortunately, in order to build something that can withstand that much pressure, you'll first need to &6compress Fericore Ingots&r into compressed iron to start with. Later on, you'll be able to make this directly from iron in a &bPressure Chamber&r.
Now that you can make Iron Ingots, you can craft a &bForge Hammer&r! This will allow you to smash all varieties of ore and even process the ingots into plates, rings, rods, and other materials.
While it is easier to do, this method of making materials is considered very inefficient, due to the cost of remaking the hammers.
You should progress onto machine processing with a &6Steam Macerator&r as soon as you're able.

Now that you have a source of Iron, you can look into enhancing your machines and gear with an anvil and any enchanments you may find. If you're lucky enough to loot an &dEnchanting Table&r, you'll have even more options! Otherwise, you'll have to wait until you make an assembler to build your own.
This quest opens up the chapter:
Esoteric Enhancements

The &b Ferricore Ingot&r is created by allowing the &6Primogel Goo&r to absorb an &6Iron Block&r next to it. Once this process completes it will turn in to a &6crystal&r which you can mine for &63-4 Raw Ferricore&r.
Ferricore Ingots can be used to create new machines and tools! Head over to the
Dire Technologies
chapter to explore this fantastical new metal ore!
With the mixer, you can now create &bPrimogel Goo&r. This mysterious goo will &6slowly transform&r some types of materials placed next to it.

Start off by creating some Fericore Ingots by placing a block of iron next to the goo and allowing it to completely transform into a crystal. For each crystal you mine, you'll get 3-4 raw ore, and &cFortune does not affect the drop rate&r.
Your boilers will need a constant supply of water. You can do this with buckets but that gets tedious.

Build a &bBronze Water Pump&r, place water blocks around it, and then give it a steam input for power. It will generate water constantly which you can pipe to your boilers or anywhere else you need water!
The &6bronze compressor&r can do any recipes up to &64 Eu/t&r, but in order to compress Ferricore into compressed iron, we'll need a stronger compressor.
The &eSteel Compressor&r can do recipes up to &e8 Eu/t&r and will be sufficient for this task!
The &bSteam Quarry&r uses &7steam&r and &6Drills&r to produce resources over time. Drills are NOT consumed in this pack.
To learn more about building it, you can check out the &bIn Game Guide&r by holding G while hovering over the Steam Quarry block.

&l&6Note&r: Different drills and tiers will yield different ores, so check the uses to best target the ores you want the most. Make sure your output is large enough to accommodate all the ore types or use multiple output hatches so you dont miss any ores!
Your First &dQuarry&r!
Now that you have bronze, you'll be able to make &eModern Indstrialization&r pipes. These are highly versatile pipes that are absolutely worth using.
You can stack up to &63 pipes in the same block space&r, you can &6dye&r them so they wont connect to each other, and you can configure each of their connection states with the wrench.
Think that's cool? Just wait, there's more.

You can go even further create a facade out of any block for the pipes to blend seemlessly into your build by &6sneak+right clicking on a block&r you want the pipes to display as, and then &6right clicking to apply the block to the pipe bundle&r. This will consume blocks from your inventory, and can easily be popped back off when you sneak+right click the block with a wrench.
And to make copying settings of pipes easier, you have been given a &6Pipe Configure Card&r!
With this tool, you can copy settings of a pipe onto the card, and then place it in your offhand. Any pipe you place like this will automatically copy the settings on the card!
The Pipe Configurator
The next thing you'll need as you work towards making circuitry is some &6Rubber!&r

Rubber can be manufactured from &bSynthetic Oil&r or &bSynthetic Rubber&r at a better yield. You can make it via &ePneumaticCraft&r or by using a &6Mixer&r. The &ePNC&r route is more efficient but will require a bit more setup, the choice is yours.
For the mixer, you'll want to pump water and &bCoke Dust&r in to create &6Raw Sythetic Oil&r. Pump that into the &bSteam Blast Furnace&r and it'll create the &6Sythetic Oil&r you need for Rubber!
Synthetic Oil or Rubber Bucket
For the next step, you'll need to turn the rubber into &bRubber Sheets&r to make your circuit plates.
This is done by combining the &6Synthetic Oil&r with paper in a &bMixer&r.
&eAnalog Circuits&r are the basis for all LV technology. You'll want to make a bunch of these in bulk as crafting them one by one can get very tedious when you just need one for a craft.
We cannot Resist this

&eModern Industrialization&r has several different cables for each tier. For &6LV&r, for example, there is &6copper, silver and Tin Cables&r. All can transfer the same amount of power with no loss in the cables.
The reason for the different types is that they &6won't connect with each other&r, allowing you to place &6multiple in the same blockspace&r (up to 3) for ease of wiring!
After you've crafted the forge hammer, you'll want to make some &bIron Plates&r which will be used in a multitude of crafting recipes.
We'll be making an &6Alloy Kiln&r soon, so make sure to have a spare &6Engineer's Hammer&r ready!
Iron Plated
With &eModern Industrialization&r, you'll find that a lot of the technology requires these specific parts.
In addition to being &6crafting ingredients&r, they act as &6functional upgrades&r as well. For example, you can &binsert a motor into your pipes to speed them up&r!
For more info, you can always check out the &l&6Modern Industrialization manual&r for a full list. You'll want to keep a good stock pile of these on hand.
Components and You

&dSilk Touch&r is important for maximizing your ore outputs. By mining them with silk touch, processing them in block form will give you more products and byproducts than standard mining. Luckily, Modern Industrialization provides a solution to this! The miraculous &bSteam Mining Drill&r can &6mine a 3x3&r area AND has a &6Silk Touch mode&r.
To use it, you'll need to provide it &9water&r by just having a bucket in your inventory or by right clicking a water source block.

To power the drill, open your inventory and drag a &6fuel source&r like coal over top of the drill and then &6right click on the drill&r to deposit the fuel. You can change the drill mode to silk touch by &6Shift+Right&r clicking while holding the drill&r.
&lNOTE: &rLater, you'll be able to upgrade it into an FE powered drill!
I had a Drill joke but it bit the dust.
Upgrading to a &6Steel Pump&r will keep up with even more machines, and you can upgrade easily by applying a &bSteel Upgrade kit&r to your bronze pumps!

If you want to upgrade your pumps further, you'll need to first craft an &6Electric Packer&r and produce some &bLapis Plates&r. With these, you can upgrade the Steel Water Pump into a &bWater Tank&r which acts as an infinite water source!
When placed near 2 blocks of water, the tank will produce 1000mb of Water 20 times per second at no fuel or &7steam&r costs!

&cRedstone Ore&r drops as a block and must be processed to get redstone dust. To do this, we can process it through the &bForge Hammer&r for now. Don't worry, you can increase your yield later on using machines!
Unlocks the Sophisticated Storage section of
Storage Wars
Powered by Sticks and Stones
If you haven't noticed, all &cbasic ore smelting mechanics have been disabled&r&r.

► In order to start processing ores, &6you'll need to first start with the Forge Hammer and then move onto special machinery&r dedicated to doing so, such as the Macerator, Crushers, Enrichment Chambers and more. If you're ever stuck trying to figure out how to process an ore, it's best to refer to EMI.
► &aFuture Quests&r should provide you with a bit more detailed info on each of the processing systems you may use as you unlock the technology to create them.
► If you hold &6shift&r while hovering over an ore type, the tooltip will tell you the best Y lvl to mine for that ore.
Also, here's a cookie.
Here's a brief explanation of the changes
Click Here
You're gonna Crush IT!
Once you have iron tier tools or better, you can harvest and process &6Gold&r! Once you have both gold and redstone, you have two very important resources for making machinery!
Head over to the
Wheels of Fortune Chapter
if you are interested in setting up your first Tree Farm using Steve's Carts 2!
A Golden Opportunity.

&6Creosote Oil&r from your coke ovens can be used to create a &btreated wood&r. This will enable you to craft many useful items and is a gateway into everything from chicken breeding to deeper &eImmersive Engineering&r machinery.
Want to try your hand at Chicken Breeding for fun and profit?
Head on over to the
What the Cluck?
chapter to get started!
Oily Wood

The &bcutting machine&r can make some plates more efficiently but is also used for cutting blocks into plates for materials that would otherwise lack direct plate recipes. It will also give you 6 planks per log when cutting wood.
It's important to note that all operations with the cutting saw take a &6small amount of lubricant&r, so automating it is advised.
You're probably finding a lot of &6Copper&r on your mining adventures, which is a good thing because you'll need it!
A lot of early machines require crafting lots of parts, like &bBolts&r and &bRods&r. You'll need to use your &bForge Hammer&r to convert your ingots into the parts you need.
And you'll do this for more than just Copper, so don't be afraid to grab all of the ores you see!
Nuts and Bolts

Although you can make &6Bronze Dusts&f by hand you'll definitely want a better way to make it and The &6Alloy Kiln&r is a good way to make other alloys in the early game, including of course your &6Bronze Ingots&r. It's built in a &62x2&r configuration using Alloy Kiln Bricks.
Once you've built a 2x2 cube of Kiln Bricks, right-click it with an &6Engineer's Hammer&r to form the Alloy Kiln!
If you see a villager, you can sneak-right click to pick them up! You're definitely just shoving an entire human (?) being into your exceptionally large back pocket.
Making a &6Villager Trading Hall&r is usually a good idea, as there are a lot of great trades that can help you through the early game!
&6Easy Villagers&r
Don't worry about making a villager breeding area, because the Easy Villager mod puts it all into a one block solution!
Supply the &6Breeder&r with 2 Villagers and some food, and it'll do its magic to create some baby villagers.
This is probably the only magic that is allowed in this pack.
Easy Villagers allows you to shove a villager in a glass box with its workstation block to create an easy way to trade!
You can reroll trades that you don't like using &6C&r by default. Looking for an easy way to automate trades? Make the &6Auto Trader&r!
Hint: &6Modern Industrialization&r has a villager by using a &bForge Hammer&r!
&6Trading In A Block&r
The &6Wrench&r is probably one of the most useful tools you'll be using during your playthrough.
This tool helps configure pipes, rotate blocks, and can even help you build multiblocks!
By holding the &6Wrench&r and looking at the base machine of a multiblock, it will create holograms of blocks to show you how to build it!
Pro Tip: Place it in your off-hand when building multiblocks!
The &6Wrench&r and You!
Using our new Alloy Kiln, place in 3 &6copper&r and 1 &6tin&r dusts or ingots to alloy them into &6Bronze&r!
The &bBronze Boiler&r is your first method of producing &7Steam&r to power all of your bronze age tech!

For it to work, you'll need to first give it &9water&r, either by manually putting buckets of water in, or by piping in water from a &6Water Pump&r. It also needs some kind of &6burnable fuel&r like coal or charcoal, which can be hoppered in for now!
Once you have both pumping into the boiler, you can pump out &7Steam&r from the output face, which is the face with a square on it. This can be changed using a &6wrench&r as well!
The first few basic machines you'll want to make are the &6Bronze Furnace&r and the &6Macerator&r.
The Bronze Furnace is powered by &bsteam&r to smelt items faster than a regular vanilla furnace.

The &bMacerator&r is crucial to providing ore multiplication, as well as getting different byproducts from several items. You should be able to get Obsidian using the Diamond Hammer you were given in an earlier quest!
Crushing and Cutting

The Modern Industrialization &bSteam Coke Oven&r is much faster than the Immersive Engineering variant, however it needs to be powered with &7steam&r to continually operate. This is another multiblock made just like the regular coke oven, except this one needs &6item and fluid hatches&r to function properly.

While that may seem complicated, these are definitely worth making! The Oven will need 2 &6inputs&r, one for &bSteam&r (which is a fluid), and one to input &6Coal&r. This will produce 2 &6outputs&r, the Creosote Oil and Coal Coke!
Faster Coke Oven
The &bCoke Oven&r will convert &6Coal&r into &6Coke&r over time.
To make one, you'll need to make a solid 3x3x3 cube of &6Coke Bricks&r, then right-clicking the center block of one side with an &6Engineer's Hammer&r to form the multiblock.
This process creates a byproduct called &6Creosote Oil&r, which you can burn for fuel or use to create &6Treated Planks&r and &6Treated Sticks&r.
Slow Coke Oven
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest1.descr: Our first goal is to convert our &bSteam&r into power for our machines!
We can do this by making the &6LV Steam Turbine&r, which produces 32 EU/t.
To transfer the power out of the Turbine, you'll need to use cables the right cables for LV power. Silver, Copper, and Tin cables are all LV cables, and they can pull a total of 256 EU/t.
If you need more, you should use different cables to make separate energy networks. Using each of the different cables, you could transfer up to 768 EU/t worth of LV power.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest10.desc: The &6Large Steam Boiler&r is a multiblock which performs the same task as many small Bronze or Steel Boilers. You can run one with just one &bBronze Water Pump&r feeding it water, but you will eventually need up to 2 &bSteel Water Pumps&r to fully provide enough water.
You can convert the logs into charcoal in a Coke Oven and burn both the charcoal and the creosote in the Boiler. You may need several coke ovens to keep up with demand!
One &6Large Bronze Boiler&r can support 8 &bLV Steam Turbines&r constantly.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest10.rich: The Boiler will need plenty of burnable fuel, which can easily be done by making a
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest11.desc: We're now ready to make the journey into a new technological age, the &6LV Age&r.
Each machine in the LV age will require these &bBasic Machine Hulls&r. You'll use &cA LOT&r of them.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest12.desc: To fuel one LV Steam Turbine, you will need either 4 Bronze Boilers or 2 Steel Boilers.
Note: You can complete this quest by having either combination in your inventory.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest13.desc: &6The Electric Packer&r is a machine used for several important recipes, including making printed circuits for &aAE2&r!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest14.desc: The &6 Heatproof Machine Casing&r will be used in a variety of multiblock structures from MI, so you'll definitely want to make a lot!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest14.subt: Let's make some Heatproof Machine Casings!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest14.titl: A Machine Casing capable of sustaining High Temps!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest15.desc: &bA Mixer&r is also a &2very essential&r machine to have from MI, as you'll be using it to &6mix&r a variety of &3Dusts&r and/or &6Materials/Components&r!
- For example, you can &6mix&r &3Quarts Dusts with a piece of Sand&r to get your first &6Silicon&r!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest16.desc: By using your recently obtained &bPacker&r, its time to make some &bPrinted Circuitry&r!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest16.subt: Yeah baby, time for some AE2!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest17.desc: By using your recently obtained &bPacker&r, its time to make some &bPrinted Silicon&r!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest18.desc: &eApplied Energistics&r allows you to convert your physical items into a digital form for quick access and storage. To get started you'll need an &benergy accepter&r to convert power into a digital signal capable of energizing the network. Head over to the &eStorage Wars&r chapter to explore more into AE.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest19.desc: &6Large Steel Tanks&r can hold a large buffer of liquids for steam or other resources. They also look pretty cool so have at it!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest2.descr: &6The Assembler&r is used to construct many advanced machines, components, and frames for technological progression. It will require power, items, and sometimes fluid as inputs to create the final product.
When crafting an item, make sure to check the EU/t required for the craft in EMI!
NOTE: You can lock input and output slots to prevent certain recipes from crafting. This is important to know for automation. Also, you're going to want A LOT of these eventually!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest2.title: &6The Assembler&r
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest20.desc: &6The Atomic Reconstructor&r can take a variety of materials and convert them into more advanced materials using energy. The item to be transformed must be placed in front of the reconstructor, and then a redstone pulse needs to be applied to activate it.
Note that this machine requires FE Power, which MI cables automatically convert from EU to FE when connected.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest20.rich: This quest will open up the chapter on
, allowing you to procure power ore and force gems.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest21.desc: &cMolten Redstone&r is a volatile substance created from superheating redstone.

You have multiple options for how you wish to create it. You can either run redstone through a &6Steam Blast Furnace&r, or you can mix redstone with lava in a &6Thermopneumatic Processing Plant&r to process it faster and more efficiently.
You'll want an automated supply of this eventually!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest22.desc: The &6Empowerer&r will further allow you to take reconstructed atomic matter such as &aVoid&r and &aEnori Crystals&r and empower them to create an even more refined material.
The recipe for each is shown in EMI, but this machine needs more than just 1 item to work!
With the Empowerer placed in the center, it needs 4 total &6Display Stands&r, each placed 2 blocks away in each cardinal direction. These will need to be powered!
Making the Empowerer will complete the quest, and the Display Stands are given as a reward!
An example of the Empowerer setup:
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest22.rich: This quest opens up the chapter
, head over there to continue progressing with Equivalent Exchange!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest23.desc: &bStorage Units&r allow for saving EU for a later time. Just like the generators, they handle the same EU rate as their tier.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest3.descr: &6The Drill&r from Actually Additions is an electric powered mining machine which can be upgraded using various augments.
Note that to use an augment of a higher tier, it requires all of the previous tiers to be installed.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest3.title: Upgrading Our &6Drill&r
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest4.descr: The &6Polarizer&r gives a magnetic charge to various items. This is primarily useful for making &6Magnetic Steel Rods&r.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest5.descr: The &6Electric Blast Furnace&r is a multiblock designed for smelting using LV energy. It's also required for smelting Bauxite Dust into &bAluminum&r Nuggets!

This multiblock is a 3x4x3 shape, with the two hollow layers of &6Cupronnickel Coils&r in the center. The top and bottom layers are made up of &bHeat Proof Machine Casings&r, and of course the hatches to provide power and bring items in and out.
The next page shows an example of a completed build.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest6.descr: Now that we have an Electric Blast Furnace, we can smelt our &6Bauxite Dust&r into &bAluminium Nuggets&r. You'll be able to make Aluminum more efficiently a bit later, but for now, this is the primary method to get you started!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest7.descr: To get Silicon, you'll need to track down a &6Meteorite&r. These are easily found by using a &bMeteorite Compass&r, made by sending a Compass through the Polarizer.
Inside of the meteorite, you'll find 9 Flawless Budding Certus and a &dMysterious Cube&r that you can be mined to get all of the &aAE2 Inscriber Presses&r.
The Flawless Budding Certus will grow &bCertus Quartz Crystals&r similar to &bAmethyst&r, and can be harvested for crystals and dust. This dust is how we'll create &6Silicon&r.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest7.title: Silicon
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest8.descr: If we want to continue our technological advancements, we'll need to create more advanced circuits, like the &6Electronic Circuit&r. These are used to get into the &6MV Age&r, as well as getting started with &bMekanism&r!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest8.rich_: questline. Head over there to continue delving deeper into Mekanism machines and processing.
for further progress into the MV Technology tier.
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest9.descr: Before we make our first Electronic Circuit, we'll need to make an &6Electronic Circuit Board&r to hold all of the components!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.quest9.subti: Just like a Surf Board... for Electronic Components!
ftbquests.chapter.lv_and_me.title: 3. LV and Me
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest1.descri: The &6Advanced Machine Hull&r starts our journey into &6Medium Voltage&r technology, and is used to build all of your MV machinery.
You can also upgrade your existing LV processing machines by inserting one into its upgrade slot. This will allow the machine to accept and process MV tier energy and recipes.
What, you didn't think you'd have to build all new machines each tier did you?
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest10.descr: Larger motors are required for more torque in higher end machines and pumps.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest11.descr: Combining &aEthylene&r with &aLead Tiny Dust&r, we can get &6Polyethylene&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest12.descr: The &6Chemical Reactor&r is an essential machine to have from &3MI&r!
This machine is used to fuse certain chemicals or items together using &achemical reactions&r, and will be useful for creating many new items and chemicals.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest13.descr: Using the &6Chemical Reactor&r, we can combine &aEthanol&r and &aSulfur Dust&r to create &6Ethylene&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest14.descr: By &bDistilling&r &6Sugar Solution&r, you can get &6Ethanol&r which we'll need for making &bEthylene&r.
Note: To complete this quest, you'll need to pump in a bucket's worth into a &cTask Screen&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest15.descr: Now that we have access to &bStainless Steel&r and &bPolyethylene&r, our circuits can become even more advanced by making &6Digital Circuit Boards&r!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest16.descr: The &6Oil Drilling Rig&r uses drills to dig up liquids.
With access to &bAluminum&r, you can make Aluminum Drills to extract &dVirulent Mixture&r from the ground, which can be refined into &2Crude Oil&r in a &bThermo Pneumatic Processing Plant&r.
Once you have access to &6Stainless Steel Drills&r, you can migrate to &6Shale Oil&r and its byproducts.
Tip: Look at the Oil Drilling Rig block with a wrench in your hand to see how to build the structure! You can also place it in your off-hand to continue building.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest16.title: Time for FREEDOM!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest17.descr: &bCentrifuging&r &cRedstone&r will give you &6Ruby Dust&r, along with several other useful byproducts including &6Neodynium&r, which you'll use for advanced magnetic applications and superconducting cabling eventually.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest18.descr: The &6Centrifuge&r spins materials at very high RPMs to separate key components into layers for further extraction.
Your most important use of this right away will be processing &braw iron&r to obtain &6Manganese&r byproducts.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest18.title: Spinny Go Fast!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest19.descr: A &6Distillery&r will be essential until you're able to make yourself a &6Distillation Tower&r later in progression.
With some &6Oil&r and the &bDistillery&r, you can now begin refining &2petrochemical byproducts&r.
There are a lot of byproducts and almost all of them will be useful. However, Distilleries can only refine 1 byproduct at a time so you'll need several of these get everything setup.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest19.title: Time to Cook!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest2.descri: The &6Vacuum Freezer&r is a multiblock machine that uses extreme temperatures to cool down items or liquids placed inside.

The multiblock structure is a hollow 3x4x3 structure made up of &6Frostproof Machine Casings&r, and hatches to input items, liquids, and power. Make sure to check the recipes for the total EU/t needed to work!
Here is an example of a completed multiblock Vacuum Freezer!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest20.descr: There are two ways you can get &6Diesel&r.
For the first method, you can use &bDistilleries&r to get &2Light and Heavy Fuels&r, and then use the mixer to combine them into &6Diesel&r.
The other method can be done by refining &2Crude Oil&r using a &9Thermo Pneumatic Processing Plant&r from PNC, which will require pressure and heat.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest21.descr: &6Diesel Generators&r can provide on-demand power by burning different fuels, most notably Diesel.
Unlike Boilers, they will only consume fuel when producing energy, making them an attractive option when you don't fully consume your maximum output regularly.
Remember, &6Diesel&r can also fuel your Boilers should you wish to use it for that!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest22.descr: With &bPolyethylene&r available, you can craft upgrades for all of your machines!
These upgrades will allow machines to overclock to perform their functions faster at the cost of greater energy consumption (FE/tick).
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest23.descr: Centrifiguring &cRuby Dust&r will yield &6Crushed Chromium&r, which you can further process into &6Chromium Dust&r.
As a nice byproduct, you'll also get pure &bAluminum Dust Piles&r to smelt for &bAluminum Ingots&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest24.descr: By &bCentrifuging&r your &bRaw Iron&r, you can extract some &6Manganese&r as well. You'll need this to form more advanced alloys in the future, like &bStainless Steel&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest25.descr: Our next step involves some Chemistry!
By &belectrolyzing salt&r, you can extract &6Chlorine&r. This is a useful chemical in fundamental chemistry, and we'll need it to progress!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest26.descr: For the next step, we'll need to combine &6Hydrogen&r and &6Chlorine&r in equal parts in a &bChemical Reactor&r to make &6Hydrochloric Acid&r (HCL).
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest27.descr: You can combine &bCrushed Chromium&r and &aHydrochloric Acid&r in a &bChemical Reactor&r to make &6Chromium Hydrochloric Solution&r.
This is then &belectroyzed&r to obtain &6Tiny Piles of Chromium&r, as well as reclaiming some of the Hydrogen and Chlorine from the acid mix.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest28.descr: Similar to the process of extracting &bChromium&r, &6Crushed Manganese&r must be combined in a &bChemical Reactor&r with a strong acid, &6Sulfuric Acid&r in this case.
This will provide you with &6Manganese Sulfuric Solution&r, which can then be sent through the &bElectrolyzer&r for &6Tiny Manganese Dust&r.
This process will yield a return of some of the sulfuric acid.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest29.descr: The &6Air Intake&r can go into the Vacuum Freezer to make &9liquid air&r.
This liquid air can then be broken down into atmospheric gases and utilized in metallurgical processes.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest3.descri: Once you have your hands on some &bStainless Steel Dust&r, you can run it through an &6Electric Blast Furnace&r to create a &6Stainless Steel Hot Ingot&r.
Run that through the &bVacuum Freezer&r to cool it down into a &6Stainless Steel Ingot&r!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest31.descr: By using &6Doped Silicon Plates&r over their regular counterparts, you can greatly increase the yield from their various recipes!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest32.descr: Your &bSteam Quarry&r can be upgraded directly into electric by using the same multiblock!

This new and improved quarry will allow you to use better drills like gold, steel, and stainless steel. If you wish to get into &2petrochemicals&r and &2sustainable diesel fuels&r, it may be worth building an oil drilling rig soon with aluminum drills for Virulent Mixture.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest33.descr: It's worth upgrading your &bLarge Bronze Boilers&r into the advanced versions now that you can make the circuitry. They produce &6four times as much steam&r!
Make sure you use the wrench on the multiblock to see the new shape and block requirements.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest34.descr: Now that we have &bManganese&r and &bChromium Dust&r, we can combine those two with some &bIron&r and &bNickel Dust&r in a Mixer to create &6Stainless Steel Dust&r.
This is needed to make more advanced circuitry, as well as for creating stronger metals to upgrade our Blast Furnace!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest4.descri: These larger pumps provide more power for us to create faster and more pressurized machines.
You'll use many of these in your factory, so it's worth having an automation chain in place for them!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest5.descri: Now that you can upgrade the EBF to Kanthal coils you'll be able to cook at much higher temperatures to forge better metals. Make sure in the user interface of the EBF you tell it that it's a Kanthal tier EBF or it won't form.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest7.descri: The &6Electrolyzer&r uses electrical currents to split the bonds between chemicals.
You can &belectrolyze water&r into &aHydrogen&r and &aOxygen&r, or &bBauxite Dust&r into &aAluminum&r directly instead of smelting it for nuggets!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest8.descri: We have everything we need to upgrade to &6Digital Circuits&r.
This dawns in a new age, the &dHigh Voltage Age&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.quest9.descri: The &6MV Steam Turbine&r consumes up to 128mb/t of &bSteam&r and produces 128 EU/t of Power.
If you haven't already upgraded your Large Bronze Boilers to the advanced versions, now might be the time!
ftbquests.chapter.mvvvvvvv.title: 4. This Tier Is Kinda Mid
ftbquests.chapter.warning_high_voltage.q: The &6Turbo Machine Hull&r is used as the base building block for &dHigh Voltage&r machines.

Similarly to using &bAdvanced Machine Frames&r, your existing processing machines can all be upgraded to this new voltage should you wish by either using the Hull directly on the machine, or by placing it in the upgrade slot of the machine.
You'll now be able to use the Quarry to get &6Tungsten Ore&r!
This can be &bMacerated&r into dust, then unpacked into tiny dust, then compressed into nuggets, then combined together to finally make &6Tungsten Ingots&r!
By &bPacking&r 3 incredibly strong ingots, you can make &6Mixed Blastproof Ingots&r!
These are needed to make the &bImplosion Compressor&r, which can then make &6Mixed Blastproof Ingots&r more efficiently.
The &6Implosion Compressor&r is used to place items under much more intense pressure than a normal compressor. This allows you to transform dusts and ingots into &bhighly blast resistant materials&r.
Most of these materials will be required for Nuclear technologies. :)
By combining &6Raw Platinum Ore&r with &6Sulfuric Acid&r in a Chemical Reactor, we can make &6Platinum Sulfuric Solution&r.
Platinum Sulfuric Solution
By Centrifuging our new Platinum Sulfuric Solution, we can extract &6Purified Platinum Sulfuric Solution&r, with a small chance to get &6Iridium Tiny Dust&r as a byproduct.
Now we can take an electrolyze the purified solution to create &6Platinum Tiny Dust&r! With 9 of these, you can create &dPlatinum Dust&r.
From here, you can run this through your &bElectric Blast Furnace&r to create a Platinum Hot Ingot, then through either a Vacuum Freezer or Heat Exchanger to cool it down!
With access to &bStainless Steel Drills&r, we can harvest &6Shale Oil&r from our oil drilling rig.
Once you have a &bDistillation Tower&r, we can run this through to get &6Helium&r, &6Sulfuric Naptha&r, and &6Sulfuric Crude Oil&r.
Shale Oil Processing
Once you've obtained &6Sulfuric Crude Oil&r, you can process it with &bHydrogen&r in a Chemical Reactor to get &6Sulfuric Acid&r and &6Crude Oil&r.
You can also run it through a Thermo Pneumatic Processing plant to get &6Sulfur Dust&r and &6Crude Oil&r. The processing route you chose is up to you!
Sulfuric Crude Processing
By combining our &6Sulphuric Naptha&r with &bHydrogen&r in a Chemical Reactor, we can separate the liquid into &6Naptha&r and &6Sulfuric Acid&r.
Sulfuric Naptha Processing
With the pure Naptha, you can combine it with &bSteam&r in another &bchemical reactor&r to make &6Steam-Cracked Naptha&r.
You'll want process the Steam-Cracked Naphtha in a new &bDistillation Tower&r with 8 outputs.
I guess you can say it isn't what it's &ocracked&r up to be.
Steam Cracked Naptha Processing
The &6Stainless Steel Drill&r will allow you access to new and important materials!
By using these drills in your &bElectric Quarry&r, you can obtain new ores like Titanium, Platinum, and Tungsten.
By using these drills in the Oil Drilling Rig, you can get your hands on &6Shale Oil&r which can be further &bDistilled&r into most of your &2petrochemical&r needs.
Diesel can be used as a fuel, or enriched into Boosted Diesel with the help of some Diethyl Ether.
Diesel
&6Boosted Diesel&r is the best liquid fuel. Note that you will need Diethyl Ether to make it (found in the petrochem distillation tree directly below).

&aAlternatively&r, you can create &bEmpowered Canola Seeds&r and run it through a &bThermo Pneumatic Processing Plant&r with &bDiesel&r to create &6Boosted Diesel&r! This is a fun alternate method of making boosted.
Boosted Diesel
&6Propene&r is used to make &6Acrylic Acid&r by combining it with &bOxygen&r in a Chemical Reactor.
And Propene Accessories
Propene
Butadiene is used to make Styrene-Butadiene.
Butadiene
You already made some Ethylene for Digital Circuits, but this is another way of getting it.
Ethylene
Benzene can be used to make more Ethylbenzene. It can also be used to make Nylon to duplicate String and Dyes!
Benzene
Toluene can be used to make &6Industrial TNT&r, which is important for use in the &bImplosion Compressor&r!
You'll probably want to setup a small automation chain for this.
Toluene
&6Vinyl Chloride&r is used to make &6Polyvinyl Chloride&r by combining it with Lead or Chromium Tiny Dust in a Chemical Reactor.
You might know it as PVC!
Vinyl Chloride
&6Acetylene&r is used to make &6Vinyl Chloride&r by combining it with &aHydrochloric Acid&r in a Chemical Reactor.
You can turn all of your Methane into Acetylene as well using an &bElectric Blast Furnace&r.
Acetylene (From Methane)
Industrial TNT is used for the Implosion Compressor.

The &6Distillation Tower&r is a much better way of breaking down &2petrochemicals&r into byproducts. It can stack, meaning one multiblock can have multiple outputs. You can have as few as one output or as many as nine to break down all possible byproducts!
Note: Make sure you set the height of the structure in the controller so that it will properly form!
You should aim to make a tower with at least 3 outputs for the next quest, like this one!
{image:ftbneotech:textures/quest/disttower.png width:125 height:150 align:center}
&6Acrylic Acid&r is used to make &6Diethyl Ether&r.
It can also be used to make Acrylic Glue, in the event you want to duplicate Slimeballs for some reason.
Acrylic Acid
You should have plenty of extra &6Oxygen&r from &bElectrolzying Water for Hydrogen&r.
Alternatively, you can &bCentrifuge Liquid Air&r, which you will need to do for &bNitrogen&r and &bArgon&r anyway.
Oxygen
While you get &6Ethylbenzene&r from Distilling Steam-Cracked Natha, you can also combine the extra Ethylene and Benzene you get to make more Ethylbenzene.
Ethylbenzene (From Ethylene and Benzene)
Using Ethylbenzene, you can combine it with &bSteam&r and &bIron Dust&r in a Chemical Reactor to create &6Styrene&r.
Styrene
By combining &6Styrene&r and &6Butadiene&r in another Chemical Reactor, we can create &6Styrene-Butadiene&r.
Styrene-Butadiene
Polyvinyl Chloride is used for advanced electronic components, upgrades, and superconductors.
Polyvinyl Chloride
While you have Ethanol from your Distilleries and Sugar Solution, perhaps you could also make more using your excess Sulfuric Acid and Ethylene?
Ethanol
&6Diethyl Ether&r is used to turn &bDiesel&r and &bBiodiesel&r into &6Boosted Diesel&r.
Diethyl Ether
&6Crude Oil&r can be processed in two different ways.
The first is to use PneumaticCraft's &bRefinery&r to get &aDiesel&r and &aLPG&r directly. This is the simpler method. You can also use the LPG to make &eRaw Biodiesel&r.

The second is to make another &bDistillation Tower&r and split the &6Crude Oil&r. This produces more &6Sulfurized Naphtha&r, as well as &bSulfurized Light Fuel&r and &bSulfurized Heavy Fuel&r. If you process those last two out and recombine them, you can get far more &bDiesel&r than you would via Refinery. However, it does take more work and more power.
Crude Oil
Combing &6Styrene-Butadiene&r with either &bLead Tiny Dust&r or &bChromium Tiny Dust&r in another Chemical Reactor, we can make &6Styrene-Butadiene Rubber&r.
This is a super insulator, and you can make tons of Rubber at a time. It can also replace some of the Sythetic Rubber used in certain recipes, like making cables!
Styrene-Butadiene Rubber
To be able to recycle our HP Water, we'll need to make the &6Heat Exchanger&r.
The &6Heat Exchanger&r is a multiblock machine that cools items or liquids down to produce other items or liquids.
We'll be using this to recycle our HP Water, but this can also be used as a more efficient way to cool &cHot Ingots&r!

This machine is 3 wide, 3 tall, and 5 blocks long. The middle section is built out of specific casings, one wall made up of &6Heatproof Machine Casings&r and the other being &6Frostproof Machine Casings&r. The item and fluid hatches can only go in certain spots, so make sure to use the &dWrench&r to help place them!
Pressurizing water into HP water consumes a lot of energy, and the &bLarge Steam Turbine&r will not return it. You can use the Heat Exchanger to recover the HP water for another cycle.
If you use the recipe that takes steam and HP water as inputs, it will output regular water and HP steam that we can use for power.
Note: Be cautious of the recipe amounts, as you might need higher tiers of hatches to meet the recipe requirements.
You'll know your hatches are too small if the recipes fail to start processing.
{image:ftbneotech:textures/quest/heatexchanger.png width:200 height:150 align:center}
For the next step, we need to combine &aArgon&r with some &aSilicon Dust&r to make &6Monocrystaline Silicon&r.
These can be cut into &6Silicon Wafers&r that we can use for advanced processor recipes and RAM.
For us to make more advanced circuitry, we'll need to make a very important module for the boards: &6Random Access Memory&r, or RAM for short.
This also unlocks the ability to make &dCrafting Units&r in &bAE2&r!
Think about it. You are using RAM in real life to make RAM in game.
No, You Can't Download More
With our new technology and chemicals, we can now create a new type of board for our electronics, the &6Processing Unit Board&r.
The &6Pressurizer&r is a special multiblock machine that can convert water or steam into the &bHigh Pressure&r versions of either that can be used in the &bHigh Pressure Large Steam Boiler&r.
The &6Pressurizer&r can also generate &bLiquid Air&r by placing an &bAir Intake&r inside of one of the Item Input Hatches of the multiblock!
Unlike most of the other multiblocks, this machine is built in a cross shape, as seen below.
{image:ftbneotech:textures/quest/pressurizer.png width:100 height:150 align:center}
The &6High Pressure Steam Boiler&r can produce up to 2048 mb/t of steam. High Pressure Steam is worth 8 times more than regular steam, so each mb will produce 8 EU/t instead of 1!
As with all boilers, to reach maximum efficiency it needs to run &acontinuously&r. It only accepts &eHigh Pressure Water and High Pressure Heavy Water&r.
The &6Large Steam Turbine&r converts either regular Steam or High Pressure (HP) Steam into energy. It generates up to 16,384 EU/t.
However, it won't return regular or HP water. To recycle HP Water, you will need to use a heat exchanger.
With &6Polyvinyl Chloride&r, you can now make &dTurbo Upgrades&r for your machines!
Until now, &6Monzanite&r hasn't been very useful except for the &bNeodynium&r.
Now you'll want to start fully extracting it for the &6Yttrium&r and &6Cadmium&r which are required for the most advanced super conducting alloys.
With &6Helium&r from our &bShale Oil&r, we can combine this with &aArgon&r in a &bVacuum Freezer&r to make &dCryofluid&r!
This can be used in a &bHeat Exchanger&r to create a faster processing line for cooling &cHot Ingots&r. You'll also need this later on to make Cooling Cells!
Helium Processing
Once our quarry digs us up some &6Platinum Ore&r, we can macerate it down into &6Raw Platinum Ore&r.
By combining &6Raw Titanium Ore&r with &bMaganese Sulfuric Solution&r in an &bElectric Blast Furnace&r, you can make &6Titanium&r &cHot&r &6Ingots&r.
Cool these down in a &bVacuum Freezer&r to get &6Titanium Ingots&r!
Now that we have &6Annealed Copper&r, we can craft the &6Advanced Components&r needed to upgrade our tech.
First, you'll need to make some &6Advanced Motors&r, which you can then use to make &6Advanced Pumps&r!
&dAdvanced&r &6Components&r
With our new boards and RAM, we can combine our current technology together to create the highly advanced &6Processing Unit&r.
&6Annealed Copper&r is Copper that has been heat-treated to make it easier to work with. This is a necessary component for crafting all of the advanced tier components.
It's made by cooking Copper with &bOxygen&r in the &6Electric Blast Furnace&r, and then cooling the hot ingot in a &bVacuum Freezer&r.
A lot goes into making a &dNuclear Reactor&r, and there are many types. To explain the process, check out the &bReactor Components&r and &bReactor Mechanics&r quests linked to this one!
&dNuclear Reactors&r produce a lot of energy, primarily as Steam.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest10: There are a lot of reactor components to keep track of, so here is a list of each of them and their function(s)!

&bFuel Rods&r: These come in many varieties, and are your main &6nuclear force&r. They are responsible for providing the reactor with energy. &6Quad Rods&r last much longer than &bSingle or Dual Rods&r (while they theoretically last 4x longer, this might not be the case, as higher reactivity will cause them to degrade quicker). Their emissivity decreases with temperature.
&bPlates&r: A general-use conductive and reflective surface. Has a high chance of converting incoming Fast Neutrons into Thermal Neutrons.

&bHeat Exchanger&r: A component designed for managing internal reactor temperature. Has a high thermal conductivity, meaning it can take heat from adjacent sources and send it to adjacent destinations.

&bWater&r: Comes in several varieties. Pressurized versions are more energy-dense, and Heavy Water produces &bTritium&r instead of &bDeuterium&r. Produces Deuterium when absorbing a Fast Neutron and increases in temperature (and turns to Steam) when absorbing a Thermal Neutron.
&bCadmium Control Rod&r: A special component that has a high chance of absorbing incoming Thermal Neutrons.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest11: Because EMI is likely making your head spin at trying to understand this, here is a simplistic overview of the many reactor mechanics.

&6Neutron Emission&r: Fuel rods emit &6neutrons&r, which start reactions. Neutrons can be Fast or Thermal, with a percent chance of being either, per neutron. &6Fuel rods&r can emit the maximum number of neutrons as seen in EMI or less depending on the temperature the fuel rod is at. Fuel rods will also emit neutrons when they absorb incoming neutrons.

&6Neutron Absorption&r: Fuel rods and reactor components have a chance to absorb an incoming fast neutron. If this occurs, the fuel rod will emit more neutrons, while other components will take a tick of durability.

&6Neutron Scattering&r: Incoming neutrons have a chance to be &bdeflected into other spaces&r. The direction it travels is random. The neutron type has a chance to become either Fast or Thermal, depending on the chance listed on the component's EMI page.

&6Neutron Travel&r: If a traveling neutron does NOT scatter or be absorbed, it "passes through" the component, maintaining its direction of travel. If a neutron travels into an unoccupied space (AKA any non-hatch), it disappears.
&6Temperature&r: When a Thermal Neutron is absorbed, it raises the temperature of the component in question.
&6Thermal Conductivity&r: The ability for the component to transmit heat. Sends heat from hot things to less hot things.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest12: Welcome to the &dNuclear Age&r! It's time to start having fun with Extreme Voltage!
The &dHighly Advanced Machine Hull&r is used for nearly all your EV tier technologies, and just like before, you can use them to upgrade your processing machines!
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest13: The &6High Pressure Advanced Steam Boiler&r is a direct upgrade for the &bHigh Pressure Steam Boiler&r and can produce up to 8192 mb/t of Steam.
As with most boilers, to achieve maximum efficiency, the boiler must be in continuous operation. It only accepts High-Pressure Water and High-Pressure Heavy Water so you have to use a pressurizer.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest14: We'll need stronger motors to make better machines. These can also provide a faster item transfer rate in pipes!
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest15: Of course there is a &6Large Advanced Pump&r.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest16: While these upgrades can be made to upgrade our machines, we can also make it for some better armor!
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest17: If we use our &6Titanium Drills&r in our Quarry, we can harvest &dIridium Ore&r.
You'll probably also have some &6Iridium Tiny Dust&r from your Platinum processing chain!
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest18: &dSuperconductor Ingots&r are used to make the highest tier of energy transfer cables available. These cables can transfer an astounding &d1.024G EU/t&r. This metal is also used for many of the late game technology recipes.

To make these, you'll need to start by mixing the dust form of Iridium, Annealed Copper, Yttrium, and Neodymium together in a mixer. This will give us &6Super Conductor Dust&r, which we can smelt in an Electric Blast Furnace into a hot ingot.
Cool that ingot down in either a Vacuum Freezer or Heat Exchanger and you'll get a &dSuperconductor Ingot&r!
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest19: Durability is a thing of the past!
The &dGravichestplate&r uses energy and enables you to have &dCreative Flight&r!
The most basic available reactor fuel is a regular &6Uranium Fuel Rod&r. It requires no fancy processing, but also outputs the least amount of energy. However, its simplicity makes it appealing to start with.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest20: You're playing with Nuclear Reactors, so the most obvious next step would be to make a &dNuke&r.
Only for testing purposes, of course. &c:)&f
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest21: It's going to take everything you've learned so far to make the ultimate circuit: the &dQuantum Circuit&r.
As long as you are observing the circuit, it will stay as one whole circuit. :)
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.quest22: To make a &dNuclear Reactor&r, you'll need &6Nuclear Alloy Plates&r. These are crafted using &bBlastproof Ingots, Beryllium Ingots, and Cadmium Ingots&r.
To get Beryllium, you'll need to centrifuge &2Emeralds&r. You should already have some &bCadium&r ready to go from processing &bMonazite&r.

Once you have Nuclear Mixed Plates, blow them up in an &bImplosion Compressor&r to create &6Nuclear Alloy Plates&r. You’ll need plenty of these for your reactors so its worth setting up a good automation line for them.
&dTitanium Drills&r are essential for producing mass quantities of &6Uranium, Iridium,&r and &6Fluorite&r.
You're going to need a fair amount of Uranium for Nuclear Power, as well as Iridium for highly advanced components.
&dUranium 235&r is a rare isotope of Uranium, as opposed to Uranium 238, its more common sibling.

When processing Nuclear Fuel Rods that used 235 in their recipe, you will get back 2/3 of the 235 you used to create it, meaning that you will need to constantly be centrifuging Uranium to get more 235.
These produce more energy than the regular Uranium Fuel Rods, but less than Plutonium-based ones.
&dPlutonium&r is a manufactured material from &6Depleted Fuel Rods&r. To get a lot of it, you might want to invest in a Breeder Reactor.

A &6Breeder Reactor&r is generally one which seeks to process fuel rods as quickly as possible with little regard for efficiency. Of course, you will need to be generating Uranium at a quick enough rate to supply it.
Plutonium rates (per rod) are as follows (Tiny Dust in -> Tiny Dust out):
&dMOX Fuel&r is generally superior to regular Uranium Fuel, with an added benefit that it produces more &6Plutonium&r than it takes to make it. A 1.33x surplus, to be precise.
This does NOT make it suitable for dedicated Plutonium production, but it does mean that you don't lose much by using it. Its high neutron output might be appealing.
By mixing Uranium 235 and 238 together, we can get HE Uranium Dust.
These can be processed into &dHE Uranium Fuel Rods&r for more efficiency!
&dDeuterium&r is a byproduct of Water in a Nuclear Reactor when it is hit with a Fast Neutron. It can be used to make Heavy Water.
&dTritium&r is the byproduct of when Heavy Water gets hit by a Fast Neutron in a Nuclear Reactor.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_extreme.title: 6. To the EXTREME
ftbquests.chapter.quantumania.quest1.des: Our first step into the &dQuantum Machines&r!
Just like all other Hulls, the &6Quantum Machine Hull&r can be used to upgrade your processing machines to the Hull's tier!
ftbquests.chapter.quantumania.quest2.des: If we want our machines to handle quantum levels of power, we'll need to make &dQuantum Upgrades&r.
The first one you make should be used on your Electric Packer to unlock new recipes!
ftbquests.chapter.quantumania.quest3.des: Using an &bImplosion Compressor&r, we can compress an &bUltradense Metal Ball&r with &b64 Nukes&r to create a &dSingularity&r.
That's right, we're compressing 64 Nukes. Surely nothing bad will happen.... right?
ftbquests.chapter.quantumania.quest4.des: Once you get your first &dSingularity&r, you can electrolyze it for &dUU-Matter&r. It will produce 1 mb of UU per operation, but also lasts forever.
ftbquests.chapter.quantumania.quest5.des: The &6Fusion Reactor&r is a &nmassive&r multiblock machine that combines two input fluids to produce &dPlasma&r that is usable for power.
We'll need this to make &dHelium Plasma&r.
ftbquests.chapter.quantumania.quest6.des: Using the &bFusion Reactor&r, we can combine several liquids together to create &dHelium Plasma&r.
There are several recipes for this Plasma! &aHelium 3&r will be the easiest to use, but the others can offer better byproducts as well.
ftbquests.chapter.quantumania.quest7.des: The &dPlasma Turbine&r is the ultimate energy producer. It uses &dHelium Plasma&r to produce over &a1 Million EU/t&r.
That's the power of &mPinesol&r Quantum, baby!
ftbquests.chapter.quantumania.quest8.des: &dQuantum Gear&r is the best there is. You can fly freely for no power cost, never take damage from external sources, and kill any mob in one hit with the &dQuantum Sword&r.
&oIt better one hit mobs since it's technically made out of the power of 64 Nukes.&r
